newsitem.title: LATVIA: SHARES EXTEND GAINS IN MODERATE TRADE.
newsitem.headline: SHARES EXTEND GAINS IN MODERATE TRADE.

text.p: * Latvian shares extended recent gains in moderate trade on Monday.
* Three of the four official list shares quoted on Monday rose. Unibanka climbed to 3.45 lats from 3.42 lats in trade of 29,000 lats.
* The bourse index rose 0.66 percent to 394.25.
* The Rietumu index crept up 0.69 percent to 153.47.
Latvian shares extended recent gains in moderate trade on Monday as low prices and the approaching end of summer lured buyers back to the market, dealers said.
Market volume was around 94,000 lats and the bourse index crept up by 0.66 percent to 394.25. The Rietumu index rose 0.69 percent to 153.47.
Three of the four official list shares quoted during the session rose with Unibanka climbing to 3.45 lats from 3.42 lats in trade of 29,000 lats.
Dealers said Unibanka could gain further in coming weeks and help pull up the rest of the market, which has been bearish for much of the summer amid low volumes.
"Unibanka should reach 3.50 lats soon," said one dealer.
Daugavpils Chain was the most active stock in trade of 34,000 lats as it shed one santime to close at 1.06 lats.
